comments: Rozier's (CHA) right arm is extended forward as marginal contact occurs with Brogdon's (IND) front during the driving shot attempt.

Sabonis (IND) turns slightly as he establishes verticality and absorbs the body contact made with Zeller (CHA) during the driving shot attempt. After absorbing the body contact, Sabonis' arm comes down slightly and brushes Zeller's arm.
Zeller (CHA) does not unnaturally extend his knee into Sabonis (IND) and the contact that occurs is marginal.
Turner (IND) and Hayward (CHA) engage and disengage with one another off ball.
Sabonis (IND) and Hayward (CHA) engage and disengage with one another off ball.
Zeller (CHA) establishes himself in a screening position in Holiday's (IND) path and does not deliver the contact.
Holiday (IND) brushes Hayward's (CHA) backside and marginal contact occurs after Hayward's gather.
Zeller (CHA) extends slightly as he attains rebounding position and marginal body contact takes place with Turner (IND) when the shot attempt occurs.

Hayward's (CHA) arm continues to move backward after back-tapping the ball and some contact occurs with Turner's (IND) head/neck area. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Zeller's (CHA) left arm is extended forward when marginal contact occurs with Lamb's (IND) front after his gather. Zeller cleanly blocks the driving shot attempt thereafter.
Zeller (CHA) and Sabonis (IND) engage and disengage with one another along the perimeter.
Graham (CHA) brings the ball across half-court prior to eight full seconds elapsing.
Hayward (CHA) establishes himself in a screening position in Brogdon's (IND) path and does not deliver the contact.
Lamb (IND) jumps alongside Hayward's (CHA) path and brushes his backside as marginal contact occurs at the end of the drive.
Turner (IND) is jumping slightly toward Hayward (CHA) with his hand extended when marginal contact occurs, and collapses his arm upon impact while absorbing the additional body contact.

call_type: Turnover:  Out of Bounds - Bad Pass Turn
comments: After communicating with the Replay Center, it was determined Hayward (CHA) touched the ball last before it went out of bounds.
Turner (IND) establishes himself in a screening position in Hayward's (CHA) path and does not deliver the contact.
Hayward (CHA) reflexively places his arm to Sabonis' (IND) front before sliding it off.
Sabonis (IND) firms up in his screening position in Hayward's (CHA) path and absorbs the contact.
Zeller (CHA) delivers body contact to Holiday (IND) that dislodges him from position.
Turner (IND) and Washington (CHA) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.
Rozier (CHA) is jumping away from Brogdon (IND) and would avoid Brogdon's right foot if Brogdon didn't extend it forward to initiate the marginal contact.
Zeller (CHA) grabs and holds Turner's (IND) left arm and affects his ability to get to the rebound.
Zeller (CHA) makes clean contact with the ball and dislodges it from Sabonis (IND) before incidental contact occurs.
Rozier (CHA) and Sabonis (IND) make incidental contact with one another going for the loose ball. After communicating with the Replay Center, the ruling on the floor of CHA ball is confirmed.
Hayward (CHA) and Brogdon (IND) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.
Brogdon (IND) commits the take foul on Hayward (CHA).
